DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Diagnostic procedure , fluorine 18-fludeoxyglucose positron emission tomography ( PET ) scan , may help doctor predict patient 's response treatment help plan best treatment . PURPOSE : This phase I trial study fluorine 18-fludeoxyglucose PET scan see well predict outcomes patient undergone high-dose chemotherapy autologous stem cell transplant non-Hodgkin lymphoma .
DOC.brief_title: PET Study Patients With Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To determine fluorine 18-fludeoxyglucose positron emission tomography scan , perform early day 30 high-dose chemotherapy autologous stem cell transplantation , may useful identify patient non-Hodgkin lymphoma may benefit early intervention , include reduce intensity stem cell transplantation additional therapy , preempt disease relapse improve overall survival . OUTLINE : Conventional imaging , biopsy , clinical examination finding review determine patient clinical outcome ( e.g. , complete remission , disease progression/relapse , death related primary disease ) .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Diagnosis nonHodgkin lymphoma Has undergone highdose chemotherapy follow autologous stem cell transplantation Vanderbilt University March 1997 August 2005 Has undergone fluorine 18fludeoxyglucose PET within 70 day prior and/or approximately 30 day 100 day highdose chemotherapy autologous stem cell transplantation PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Not specify PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics
